etymology.description: 小(小) (xiǎo, "small") + 冋(冋) (jiōng, "closed") = closed top -> high -> esteem
etymology.interpretation: The character 尚(尚) (shàng, "esteem") combines 小(小) (xiǎo, "small") with 冋(冋) (jiōng, "closed") to form a pictorial top. This signifies something being elevated or raised, symbolizing esteem or admiration. The closed top connotes positioning at a height or high standing.

examples.chinese: 他非常尚重传统(他非常尚重傳統)。
examples.english: He holds tradition in high esteem.

examples.chinese: 公司尚人才(公司尚人才)，视员工为家人(視員工為家人)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī shàng réncái, shì yuángōng wéi jiārén.
examples.english: The company esteems talent and regards its employees as family.
